required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Investigating Nutrition and Functional Outcome in Critically Ill Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Investigating Nutrition and Functional Outcome in Critically Ill Patients

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single-center, multi-ICU prospective observational trial evaluating current nutritional practice and its influence of the physical function of critically ill patients.

detailed_description.textblock:
The investigators propose a prospective observational, single-center, multi-intensive care unit trial to evaluate the influence of current nutritional practice on the physical outcome in critically ill patients. At least 100 consecutive patients requiring surgery, who are admitted to any surgical ICU at the University Hospital RWTH Aachen will be recruited. Nutritional practices, such as dosage, timing and route of administration of the nutrition, as well as complications regarding the nutrition will be recorded and analyzed longitudinally from ICU-admission until hospital discharge. Patient outcomes, such as ICU- and hospital length of stay, duration of mechanical ventilation, organ dysfunction, complications and infections will be evaluated. To assess physical function of the patient, muscle mass, muscle strength, the ability of the patient to self-mobilize and perform every day activities will be measured.
This observational trial aims to assess the current standard of nutritional practice in the ICU, to detect problems and complications and to gather first evidences about the influence of nutrition on the physical function of the patient. This study also aims to compare the outcome of the predefined subgroups of critically ill patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Nutritional status - basic demographics
primary_outcome.time_frame: at Study inclusion
primary_outcome.description: Chart review

primary_outcome.measure: Nutritional Status - nutritional screening
primary_outcome.time_frame: intensive care unit (ICU) admission, up to 1 week
primary_outcome.description: Nutritional Risk Screening 2002 (Score: 0-7; if ≥3 patient at nutritional risk)

primary_outcome.measure: Nutritional Status - nutritional risk in the critically ill (NUTRIC)
primary_outcome.time_frame: ICU admission, up to 1 week
primary_outcome.description: NUTRIC score (Score 0-10; if interleucin-6 (IL6) available 0-5=low malnutrition risk; if IL6 not available 0-4= at low malnutrition risk

primary_outcome.measure: Nutritional Status - Waist and mid-arm circumferences
primary_outcome.time_frame: Study inclusion, up to 1 week
primary_outcome.description: Waist and mid-arm circumferences

primary_outcome.measure: Differences of dosage of nutrition
primary_outcome.time_frame: until discharge from intensive care unit, an average of 30 days
primary_outcome.description: Cumulative delivery of macronutrients by infusion rates

primary_outcome.measure: Differences of dosage of nutrition
primary_outcome.time_frame: until discharge from intensive care unit, an average of 30 days
primary_outcome.description: Cumulative delivery of macronutrients by cumulative count of macronutrients

primary_outcome.measure: Differences of dosage of nutrition
primary_outcome.time_frame: until discharge from intensive care unit, an average of 30 days
primary_outcome.description: Cumulative delivery of macronutrients by nutrition used

primary_outcome.measure: Timing of nutrition
primary_outcome.time_frame: until discharge from intensive care unit, an average of 30 days
primary_outcome.description: Chart Review- start and stop times

primary_outcome.measure: Timing of nutrition - reason for discontinuation
primary_outcome.time_frame: at discharge from intensive care unit, an average of 30 days
primary_outcome.description: Chart review

primary_outcome.measure: Differences in route of administration of nutrition
primary_outcome.time_frame: discharge from intensive care unit, an average of 30 days
primary_outcome.description: Rates of oral, enteral and parenteral nutrition, feeding tubes and catheters used for nutrition

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Gastrointestinal symptoms
primary_outcome.time_frame: discharge from intensive care unit, an average of 30 days
primary_outcome.description: Chart review (vomiting, nausea, high gastric residual volumes, diarrhea, obstipation, aspiration, ileus, bowel ischemia)

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence Blood work irregularities
primary_outcome.time_frame: discharge from intensive care unit, an average of 30 days
primary_outcome.description: Chart review (electrolyte imbalance, blood sugar imbalance, dyslipidemia)

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Refeeding syndrome
primary_outcome.time_frame: discharge from intensive care unit, an average of 30 days
primary_outcome.description: Chart review

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of complications related to the route of administration
primary_outcome.time_frame: discharge from intensive care unit, an average of 30 days
primary_outcome.description: Chart review (central venous catheter infection, misplaced and dislocated enteral feeding tubes)

primary_outcome.measure: Nutrition adequacy
primary_outcome.time_frame: discharge from intensive care unit, an average of 30 days
primary_outcome.description: Rates of energy and protein received in comparison to nutritional targets Chart review

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Muscle mass - Mid-arm circumference (MAC)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Study inclusion, discharge from intensive care unit and hospital discharge, up to 3 months
primary_outcome.description: MAC

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Muscle mass - Quadriceps thickness
primary_outcome.time_frame: Study inclusion, discharge from intensive care unit and hospital discharge, up to 3 months
primary_outcome.description: ultrasound

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Muscle mass - Quadriceps cross sectional area
primary_outcome.time_frame: Study inclusion, discharge from intensive care unit and hospital discharge, up to 3 months
primary_outcome.description: ultrasound

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Muscle strength - Handgrip strength
primary_outcome.time_frame: discharge from intensive care unit and hospital discharge, up to 3 months
primary_outcome.description: Dynamometry

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Muscle strength - Quadriceps strength
primary_outcome.time_frame: discharge from intensive care unit and hospital discharge, up to 3 months
primary_outcome.description: Dynamometry

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Physical function - Functional Status Score for the ICU
primary_outcome.time_frame: discharge from intensive care unit and hospital discharge, up to 3 months
primary_outcome.description: Functional Status Score for Intensive Care Unit (FSS-ICU) (Score 0-35; the higher the score, the better physical functioning)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Physical function - Short Physical Performance Battery
primary_outcome.time_frame: discharge from intensive care unit and hospital discharge, up to 3 months
primary_outcome.description: Short Physical Performance Battery (SPPB) (Score: 0-12; 0=worst performance and 12=best performance)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Physical function - 6-Minute Walk Test
primary_outcome.time_frame: discharge from intensive care unit and hospital discharge, up to 3 months
primary_outcome.description: 6-minute walking distance

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Physical function - Manual Muscle Testing (MMT)
primary_outcome.time_frame: discharge from intensive care unit and hospital discharge, up to 3 months
primary_outcome.description: MMT

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Physical function - Katz Activities of Daily Living (ADL)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Hospital discharge, day 30 after study inclusion, up to 3 months
primary_outcome.description: ADL (Score: 0-100; the higher the more independent)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Physical function - Lawton Instrumental Activities of Daily Living (IADL)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Hospital discharge, day 30 after study inclusion, up to 3 months
primary_outcome.description: IADL (score 0-8; the higher the more independent)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Physical function - Clinical Frailty Score (CFS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Study inclusion, Hospital discharge, day 30 after study inclusion, up to 3 months
primary_outcome.description: CFS (score 1-9; 1= Very fit and 9=terminally ill)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Fat mass
primary_outcome.time_frame: Study inclusion, discharge from intensive care unit and hospital discharge, up to 3 months
primary_outcome.description: Thigh and abdominal fat (ultrasound)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Neuro-psychological function - Mini Mental State Examination (MMSE)
primary_outcome.time_frame: discharge from intensive care unit, Hospital discharge, day 30 after study inclusion, up to 3 months
primary_outcome.description: MMSE (Score 0-30; 30= no dementia and <9= severe dementia)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Neuro-psychological function - Becks Depression Inventory (BDI)
primary_outcome.time_frame: discharge from intensive care unit, Hospital discharge, day 30 after study inclusion, up to 3 months
primary_outcome.description: BDI (Score 0-63; 0= no depression and 63= severe depression)

primary_outcome.measure: Quality of life - Short Form 36 (SF-36)
primary_outcome.time_frame: day 30 after study inclusion
primary_outcome.description: SF-36 (Score: 0-100; 100=no limitation in daily life and 0=completely limited)

primary_outcome.measure: Quality of life - Living location
primary_outcome.time_frame: day 30 after study inclusion
primary_outcome.description: Rates of patients being discharged to nursing home, rehabilitation, home care etc. Discharge location used as surrogate for physical fitness after hospital discharge.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 30 days after study inclusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Length of stay - intensive care unit length of stay
secondary_outcome.time_frame: discharge from intensive care unit, an average of 30 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Length of stay - Hospital length of stay
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Hospital discharge, an average of 60 days
Hospital discharge, day 30 after study inclusion, up to 3 months
up to 30 days after study inclusion, up to 3 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in acute organ dysfunction - sepsis-related organ failure assessment (SOFA score)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to discharge from intensive care unit, an average of 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: daily records (score 0-24; 0=normal function and 24= massively impaired function)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to discharge from intensive care unit, an average of 30 days
up to discharge from intensive care unit, an average of 30 days
up to discharge from intensive care unit, an average of 30 days

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to discharge from intensive care unit, an average of 30 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Acute organ dysfunction - duration of ventilation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to discharge from intensive care unit, an average of 30 days
up to discharge from intensive care unit, an average of 30 days
up to discharge from intensive care unit, an average of 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: dosage of sedation, cumulative dosage in ml/d

secondary_outcome.measure: Acute organ dysfunction - Richmond Agitation Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to discharge from intensive care unit, an average of 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: Richmond Agitation Scale (score: +4 - -5; +4=aggressive behavior, 0=calm,-5=not reacting to verbal or physical approaches)

secondary_outcome.measure: Acute organ dysfunction - Confusion Assessment Method for the ICU (CAM-ICU)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to discharge from intensive care unit, an average of 30 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Persistent Organ Dysfunction - Incidence of mechanical ventilation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Hospital discharge, day 30 after study inclusion, up to 3 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Persistent Organ Dysfunction - Incidence of hemodynamic parameters
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Hospital discharge, day 30 after study inclusion, up to 3 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Persistent Organ Dysfunction - Incidence of renal replacement therapy

Hospital discharge, day 30 after study inclusion, up to 3 months

arm_group.description: Non-elective admission to the neurosurgical ICU with one of the following acute intracranial pathologies which also serve as predefined subgroups: Intracranial hemorrhage (subarachnoid, subdural hemorrhage or intracerebral hemorrhage) Acute and severe head trauma with an initial Glasgow Coma Scale ≤10
Age ≥ 70 years, predefined subgroups: ≥ 70 years and ≥80 years
BMI ≥ 35 kg/m2, furthermore predefined subgroups of patients with BMI ≥ 40 kg/m2 and BMI ≥ 45 kg/m2

Admission to the cardiosurgical ICU after one of the following procedures using cardiopulmonary bypass, which also serve as predefined subgroups: Coronary revascularization (coronary artery bypass graft) Heart valve surgery Combined or complex heart surgery
Admission to the abdominal surgery ICU after abdominal surgery

intervention.intervention_name: Functional tests without clinical consequence for the patients therapy
intervention.description: Battery of tests, which measure the patients functional outcomes regarding their muscle mass, their muscle strength, fat mass, physical function, neuropsychological function and quality of life.

study_pop.textblock: This is a clinical trial, which will include critically ill patients after informed consent. Patients who admitted to a surgical ICU following surgery or requiring surgery can be screened and included by our team. The general eligibility criteria are listed above. We will recruit patients, who can be classified as one of the following groups: a) neurosurgical Patients, b) elderly patients, c) obese patients, d) cardiac surgery patients and e) abdominal surgery patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Informed consent
- Adult patients (≥ 18 years)
- Patients admitted to a surgical ICU requiring surgical Intervention
- Patients requiring sedation and invasive ventilation for ≥ 48 hours
- Patients with an expected ICU-length of stay ≥ 72 hours
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or lactating patients
- Patients already receiving an intense nutrition support (home parenteral or enteral nutrition) in addition to normal nutrition on hospital admission
- Patients with disabling disease (neurological or physical) that prevents them from walking, sitting or standing before ICU admission
- Patients unable to follow orders from the study personnel (language barriers, neurological, psychiatric disorders)
- Death expected within 96 hours after admission due to severity of disease
- Enrolment in an industry sponsored randomized trial within the last 30 days (co-enrolment in academic randomized trials will be considered on a case by case basis)
